Mia Borders and her band have gained incredible momentum for their energetic blend of funk and soul with a contemporary songwriting style, and were branded \"New Orleans' hottest buzz band\" by Where Y'at Magazine. To see videos and read reviews from Bonnaroo 2010 click here: www.bigsamsfunkynation.com/bonnaroo2010. Baton Rouge, LA\nWhen: Thursday, October 28th | 10:30pm\n\nThursday, October 28th Big Sam's Funky Nation's spine tingling grooves will join Grupo Fantasma's bombastic blasts for an all night Halloween Horn Fest @ Chelsea's!\n\nGrupo FantasmaGrammy-nominated Latin powerhouse Grupo Fantasma\nhttp://grupofantasma.com\nKnown as the funkiest, finest, and hardest working Latin orchestra to come out of the United States in the last decade, the band has garnered critical acclaim worldwide for their adventurous albums, prudent songwriting and unprecedented live shows.  \"Grupo Fantasma is as tight as one would expect from a band that routinely backs up Prince.\" The progressive genius of Grupo Fantasma, now in the tenth year of its long and intriguing musical journey. In so many ways their music is a bundle of contrasts and contradictions. It is art made on the hyphen, a hybrid Latin-American beast of many dancing legs, hearts and minds. Grupo Fantasma knits together the rural with the urban, melds Anglo, Afro, and Latino with such expert carefree abandon you barely notice it - it's so natural seeming.  It's not until you try to describe all the song genres (futile) or unravel the strands (too intertwined) that you realize the music is actually quite a complex web of artifice, with the ultimate revelation that you have been witnessing a sublime collective consciousness at work and a group that finishes with something that sounds both intentional and whole. The band's incendiary live show has also stockpiled rave reviews across North American, Europe, and beyond.\n\nNew Orleans' own Big Sam's Funky Nation Big Sam\nwww.bigsamsfunkynation.com\nBig Sam's Funky Nation is led by trombone powerhouse \"Big Sam\" Williams, formerly of the Dirty Dozen Brass band, who has been celebrated as \"the top man on the slide trombone in the birthplace of jazz\" by the San Francisco Chronicle. BSFN has been voraciously touring and making their musical presence known everywhere. This summer, BSFN was dubbed \"The hardest working band at Bonnaroo 2010\" by the festival's own Bonnaroo Beacon. To see videos and read reviews from Bonnaroo 2010 click here.
